meanings.definition: To negotiate a better deal than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outbargain the seller and get a lower price for the car.
meanings.sent2: I always try to outbargain at the flea market to save money.
meanings.sent3: The clever shopper was able to outbargain the store owner and walk away with a great discount.
meanings.sent4: In the world of negotiation, he was known to outbargain his opponents effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to outbargain made her the go-to person for getting the best deals.

meanings.sent1: He was able to outbargain his competitors and secure the contract for his company.
meanings.sent2: The skilled negotiator knew how to outbargain others without being unfair.
meanings.sent3: The student managed to outbargain his classmates in the trading game during the economics class.
meanings.sent4: She always found a way to outbargain her friends in friendly competitions.
meanings.sent5: His determination to outbargain everyone else made him a formidable opponent in the market.
